story:
Summary:

My name is Keenan Jolliff and I am creating a theater piece called Proprioception. My pursuit in this piece is to find the place where movement and acting can live together on stage. I am interested in what happens when worlds collide. I think that there is an innate beauty in the risk of bringing two separate things together – finding harmony, exploring discourse, and discovering the places where things spontaneously line up.

In order to really explore this collision of worlds, the process of creating the piece will involve many collaborative endeavors, most prominently in the musical score for the piece. Two of my best friends have written separate tracks in separate genres, and my music producer and I are enforcing the collision process, and seeing where things land.

These tracks will be the spine of the show. They will inform where the movement goes, how the show feels, and where we decide to take the piece as a whole. Thus, it’s very important for me to be able to share them with anyone who cannot make it to the show. So we are planning on making physical copies of the CD’s with original artwork (which is also a collaboration between friends).

 

Your Donations:

Your donations will go straight into the creative process of the show. We will need to split the funding between building the set, printing physical copies of the soundtrack, and advertising the show --- all of which will be covered fully with $500.

All funds that are raised past the initial $500 will be put towards future renditions of the show!!! So... that's always welcome as well ;).

 

Other Ways To Help:

If you can’t spare any donations, there are plenty of other ways you can help! We are trying to get the word out about this show as much as possible, so just tell some friends, share this link on Facebook, or just come on out to see the final product! That’s the most important part of all of this!

story:
** On 1.11.11 we made our goal thanks to you!

but KEEP GOING!  We can use every dollar on this film. 

After Nov. 8th head to theindependentcollective.com/join to contribute

Thank you!


EVERY CLICK AND EVERY SHARE HELPS US OUT!

Thanks for taking a look:)

OUR STORY

Tiny Dancer has been in development since The Cake Eaters, Jayce’s first film starring Kristen Stewart, has been on the festival circuit. That's a long time! The changing climate in film financing has made it nearly impossible to get this production off the ground in the traditional manner, but our desire to make this film has grown increasingly into a kind of obsession, a common progression in the creative world. We have to make this film or else. It keeps us up at night.

The film is about legendary dancer Lauren Drake, played by Martha Graham principal Katherine Crockett, who has just become a mother and is struggling to balance her drive for perfection and her journey to dance again. It also stars Tony and Spirit Award nominee, Daphne Rubin-Vega (Rent, Jack Goes Boating). We can all relate to transitioning from one label in our lives to another, and Lauren Drake is struggling with the disappearance of her label of “star dancer” as she morphs into her new label of “mother.”

Lauren Drake has left the art she loves when she has her baby, but for whatever reason, she feels incomplete just being a mother. She comes to the conclusion that she has to dance again and risks her family, her marriage, and her friendship to find what makes her truly happy. This is a story that is often unexplored because motherhood is viewed as something that should satisfy in and of itself, and to want more -- to have it all -- is seen as impossible, even selfish at times. But what is an artist to do when she can only express herself through her talent? 

We created an organization called The Independent Collective with the idea that you buy a membership and get cool stuff related to the film to raise our budget. Sound familiar? We are fiscally sponsored by The New York Foundation for the Arts (NYFA) which makes contributions to our film 100% tax-deductible, even here at IndieGoGo, where we turned to jump-start our completion efforts! 

Our project has grown incredibly in the last year and only because of people like you. We were featured on The Huffington Post; we secured stars Daphne Rubin-Vega and Katherine Crockett and Director of Photography Kate Phelan; we shot three days in Ft. Greene, Brooklyn, and at The Mark Morris Dance Center on two Sony F3s. In very recent news we are thrilled to announce that the project will be in collaboration with the legendary dancer, Desmond Richardson of Complexions. We assembled our footage into a promo piece and are presenting it on Sept. 19 at a fundraiser sponsored by Dance Magazine and created a trailer for you to see the direction we are going in with this film (click above!)

But I’ve already given you money?!

Thank you! Seriously! We thank you every day in our creative world of editing, rewriting, and pitching! With your funds, we had an incredible three-day shoot, and you can see the teaser we created from that here. We were able to test our cameras and have since used this footage for more fundraising and to secure more attachments and support for the film. You can still help us by considering giving again, and it’s still TAX-DEDUCTIBLE. Or, you can spread this campaign with a passionate call to action!


Simply engaging on this site by clicking links in the campaign, watching and sharing the campaign or video increases our "GoGo Factor" on the site and our chances of being featured. So by all means, go ahead!  Your clicking is very valuable to us!



If our campaign does not work, our climb becomes that much longer. We have an INCREDIBLE cast and crew waiting for the green light. Everything is in place EXCEPT for the funds. We want to deliver this film to you. We want to hit the festivals with it, get it distributed by any means necessary, and tell the story of Lauren Drake, a woman who leaves her passionate and established career as a principal dancer to become a mother... and ultimately finds herself unfulfilled. This is a theme that seems so simple, yet is actually unexplored, unaddressed, and generally “un” in the film world. We want this discussion to begin.

How is our campaign different from the millions of others in your inbox?

Because it’s our campaign, and we finish our stuff, and it comes out! And you will be the first to see it,because you've believed in us.  Also, we aren’t messing around.  We have assembled an amazing team of talented performers. We don’t just want to make a movie; we want to make a film of the highest order.  Check out our reel, see our trailer, look us up, Google us, we’re crazy about finishing this film, and we mean business. I’m sitting here typing meaning BIZ-NESS. 

Other ways you can help!

“I’m broke, I’m like you trying to make my film, but I can Tumble, Follow, Like, Embed!”  To this we say, “Yes, Please!” and “Thank you!” We truly are so appreciative and love every shout out and thumbs-up.  Share this campaign right now if you can. 


Be sure to stay in the loop @TICNYC and to follow Jayce's blog about our progress at MovieMaker.com

 

Thanks everyone for your unrelenting support! 


**a note about checks- if you would rather send a check, email me at tiffany at theindependentcollective.com- it's a little tricky...

story:
Short Summary

This summer, Villagers are invited to come visit the Fishbowl in a new comedic work by local Edmonton artist Fiona Williams. Finding Nymma introduces us to the strange and charming Nymma Gruen, a talented research librarian who has created a secret world: The Fishbowl, in a quiet, unused corner of the top floor of her library. Despite her practical research librarian demeanor, Nymma begins to believe the Fishbowl exists in a world all its own as she secretly hula hoops, eats decadent chocolate, and writes haikus all while keeping up a healthy dialogue with her betta fish Jacques. Nymma’s world remains a secret until the unthinkable happens: someone notices….. Now, Nymma must not only consider breaking the spell of the Fishbowl but also a romance with a handsome stranger.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm asking for $500.00.  Finding Nymma goes up a BYOV at the fringe.  (A Bring-Your-Own-Venue).  This is great because we get lots of flexibility but it means the show costs a bit more to put up.  Here's an idea of some of the costs involved with BYOV Fringe shows:

Venue: $1250.00

Technician: $600.00

Fringe Admin Costs: $550.00

Media/Publicity: $250.00

 

The Impact

For many artists in Edmonton and across Canada, Fringe is a huge source of income.  Both Michelle (my director) and Daniela (my designer) work as independent artists and their goal is to make that their only source of income.  As Fringe artists, we do get 100% of the ticket costs associated with the show but sometimes this only covers the cost of show and doesn't allow artists to walk away with some compensation for their work at the end.

 

For more info you can check out:

www.michellekennedy.net

https://twitter.com/owlandbuffalo

 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's cool if you aren't in a position to help us financially but please consider sharing this campaign with your friends, posting it on your blog or sharing the link far and wide... we'd really appreciate it!

 

I only have credit card at the moment but will try to add PayPal.

story:
Our Story

In PARKER & DIZZY’S FABULOUS JOURNEY TO THE END OF THE RAINBOW, Vicky Luster, famed songstress of the Valley of the Balls nightclub has been shot by a mysterious man in her dressing room. Barely clinging to her final breaths, she musters enough energy to scribble, ‘SCRAM VENGEFUL MIS’ in lipstick on her vanity. Her assistant, Parker, and choreographer, Dizzy, discover not only her dead body but her cryptic message. What follows is a crazy, campy musical epic adventure as Parker and Dizzy venture out to reveal their employer’s murderer, and end up uncovering more, including dead bodies, drag queens, an evil mentor, and the revelation of the gay holy grail leading to a fabulous climactic showdown. 


If The Wizard of Oz married Star Wars but cheated with Thelma & Louise and got pregnant by the The Da Vinci Code, the baby would be this show! 


The Impact

PARKER & DIZZY’S FABULOUS JOURNEY TO THE END OF THE RAINBOW is a brand-new musical, with a book by Peter Zachari and original songs written by Damon Maida and Peter Zachari. And now we have been selected to premiere our show at The New York International Fringe Festival.  (www.fringenyc.org) We are thrilled to have this fantastic opportunity to bring these characters to New York City, and now we need your help. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need to mount a production of this complete with costume, sound, props, musicians, publicity, the works. Your donation to this project will help make this dream of ours a reality. By contributing money to this project, you are helping the artists associated with this project to see an original production come to fruition. We have set our goal at $5000 but if we reach that, please keep giving! Every cent raised on this site will absolutely go to the funding of this production. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word! Tell your friends about us. Visit our Facebook page. And please, above all else, come and see the show! We would love to see everyone there.

The Players

Peter Zachari (Playwright/Lyrics) has written Lighten Up!, which was produced off-off-Broadway, as well as Loosen Up!, Shake It Up!, Live It Up!, One Love and his newest play Parker and Dizzy’s Fabulous Journey to the End of the Rainbow. Mr. Zachari’s directing credits include Into the Woods, Footloose, Rumors, Grease, West Side Story, They’re Playing Our Song, Return to the Forbidden Planet and Moon Over Buffalo .  As an actor, his New York credits include Street Scene (The York Theatre Company), Connections (Actors Theatre of America), 1940’s Radio Hour (The Emelin Theatre), The All-Male Importance of Being Earnest (New York International Fringe Festival), and Happy Hour (The Producers’ Club).  Regional credits include Love’s Labour’s Lost (Huntington), The Illusion, All in the Timing, Laughter on the 23rd Floor, A Christmas Carol and 4R Planet (Hippodrome State Theatre); Big River and Young Abe Lincoln (Lincoln Amphitheatre); A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum, Last of the Red Hot Lovers, Mary, Mary (Summer Theatre at Salem); The Flatlanders (Dollywood) and Fiddler on the Roof and Cabaret (Center for the Performing Arts, Gainesville).  His television credits include “White Collar,” “As the World Turns,” “The Life of Lizzie Borden,” and “Half Empty.”  He received his M.F.A. from the University of Florida and his B.F.A. from Salem State College. 


Joey Mirabile (Choreographer) has choreographed productions of Footloose, Grease and Into the Woods for Summer Theatre at Salem as well as Godspell, Cinderella, Holly Jolly Follies and Broadway Our Way. Acting credits include Company (Bobby), Grease (Danny), They’re Playing Our Song (Vernon), Footloose (Garvin), Antigone (Sentry), The Snow Queen (Jack Frost), Six Degrees of Separation (Rick), 42nd Street (Billy Lawlor). He could be seen as Nathaniel Hawthorne in Spirits of the Gables at the House of Seven Gables every Halloween in Salem. Joey is also known as “Coco of Times Square.”


Damon Maida (Music/Lyrics) is a singer and songwriter based in New York City. As a performer, he has appeared at some of New York's premiere listening rooms (The Bitter End, Symphony Space, Piano's,Triad) . Damon is a frequent co-writer and is excited to be working with Peter Zachari, composing music for "Parker & Dizzy..." When not writing songs with Peter, Damon can be seen singing with his vocal band The Perspective (www.theperspectiveband.com). Also an actor and voice-over artist, Damon's voice can be heard on a number of children's video games, commercials, and the newest "World of Warcraft: Cataclysm" video game. Damon is currently writing music for the follow-up to his debut album, "Only Child," available through CD Baby (http://cdbaby.com/cd/maida) and Apple ITunes.

story:
Hello, lovely people!


I am super-passionate about creating a sea change in how artists are prepared in this country. I am a professionally trained opera singer who was an actor in New York City for a time and I have taught people how to sing for over twenty years now. For performing artists, their body is their instrument, and yet at most performing arts' schools, students are not taught how to take care of their bodies and so aren't fully prepared for a career in the performing arts. I think it's time for this to change.

At the University of Oklahoma, I've begun to teach my students whole body maintenance - nutrition, spinal health and alignment and emotional and mental health. But to change the entire focus, I need to become an Alexander Technique Teacher. Once I become an Alexander Teacher, I want to take the teaching nationally - I will publish a book, keep a video blog and travel the country to give young artists the tools they need to maintain their whole body as their instrument.

Interested? Please read on...

My name is Gwen Walker and I teach musical theatre voice at the University of Oklahoma. 

I have just completed my first year of a four-year study to become an Alexander Technique teacher.

What is the Alexander Technique?

Alexander Technique is an age-old way to reduce stress and tension in your body. It helps increase performance, reduce pain, and prevent injury. I have been a student of the technique for twenty-five years and am now studying to become a teacher. If you’re interested, I’ve attached a whole bunch of links explaining the technique and the science behind it below.

I am not doing this for me.

It's bigger than that. The purpose of my fundraising is so that I can reach as many young performers as I can while I can. 

Student Testimonials

I asked some of my students (past and present) to say a few words about my work. I think you can see a glimpse of my devotion to them in their comments. Thank you, sweet people!

Perry S.
Andrew K.
Kyle I.
Courtney B.
Kyra W.
Dorcas L.
Cory L.
Basit S.
Jamie B.
Aaron B.

Want to learn more about Alexander?

Short introduction to AT by Marjorie Barstow - my teacher's teacher
Alexander Technique introduction by Brett Hershey
Alexander Technique for Musicians
What happens in an Alexander Technique lesson? (Amira Alvarez)

The Details

Here's the fine print:

  • I am training at the Alexander Alliance Southwest (Alexander Alliance Southwest website)
  • I must attend at least five training intensives a year. Every intensive training lasts for 7-10 days and the average training fee is $1,000.
  • In addition to the training fee, I have to pay for travel, room, and board. I travel from Norman, Oklahoma to Santa Fe, New Mexico. Typical travel, room, and board expenses are around $1,200. 
  • I have received funding of $3,000 for the upcoming year, so I only need to raise the remaining $8,000 to fund the full year. 
  • Don't worry if I don't raise all the funds here! I will not quit until I am done with the training. I'm tenacious that way, and as you can probably tell, I'm very passionate about doing this!
  • How will I pay for the final two years? I am writing grants to pay for the final two years of my training.
  • ABSOLUTELY EVERY SINGLE PENNY RAISED ON THIS SITE WILL GO TOWARD MY TRAINING or MY TRAINING EXPENSES. I PROMISE.

The Science!

The Alexander Technique is a scientific study. Here are some links to explore if you are curious about the man, his discoveries and the people who have continued his research:

Alexander Technique explained by Nikolaas Tinbergen in his award-winning Nobel Prize speech

Dr. John Austin, Columbia University Medical School, talks about how AT helps breathing

Dr. Theodore Steinmean, Harvard Medical School, describes the benefit of AT in pain management

Dr. Jack Stern, Yale University School of Medicine, talks about the benefit of AT for back pain sufferers

A little bit about why...

I don't think I'd be walking if I hadn't been offered an Alexander Technique class in graduate school. I had severe back pain that prevented me from enjoying my life or pursuing my chosen craft of singing. Right before I took my first Alexander class, I went to a chiropractor who said I wouldn't be walking in five years. All that has changed. I have been a student of the Alexander Technique for twenty-five years and still I run and exercise daily. I feel great. That is why I decided that I need to become a teacher of Alexander so that I can create more change for more people and prevent more people from getting as sick as I was then. I firmly believe that if I hadn't had Alexander training, I would be walking with a cane and be obese due to lack of exercise because of pain. There are a lot of people in my family just like that. Alexander changed my life and I want to pass it on to everyone that I can. And PS - helping people get out of their own way and achieve their potential is a pretty great way to spend your time. :)

Other Ways You Can Help!

I completely understand if you're not able to contribute financially, but if you can help me spread the word about my campaign it would be a big help!

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign!
  • Post a link on Facebook or Twitter!
  • Indiegogo has some great share tools to make it easy!

YOUR CONTRIBUTION MEANS THE WORLD TO ME. Every penny counts and (as they say here in Oklahoma), I really appreciate you.

story:
DEEPEST MAN

A 3LD 3D + Production

Executive Producer: Kevin Cunningham

The world premiere of DEEPEST MAN  will begin performances May 22, 2014 and continue through June 14, 2014.

at: 3LD Art + Technology Center

80 Greenwich Street, NYC, NY

Tickets  $20.00 / www.ovationtix.com

Info: www.deepestman.com

 

DEEPEST MAN is a dark, new-age-science, multimedia theatrical production. It delves into the controversial and amazing properties of water:

"Water has consciousness"

"Water has memory"

Searching for release from his great grief, the lead character discovers the alluring comfort of an extreme sport, freediving. He ultimately finds solace through an intimate relationship with a famous television talk show host. He believes she speaks directly to him, through his television.

Dogma versus delusion, science versus metaphysics, disaster capitalists versus survivors, DEEPEST MAN weaves a complex narrative flowing from the mind of a man teetering on the edge.

DEEPEST MAN is written by award winning playwright James Scruggs, and  directed by Mark Rayment of London’s West End. Featuring actors, Spencer Barros, Vienna Carroll, Alva Chinn, Skid Maher, Miguel Reis and Libby Skala. 

Video Design by Grant McDonald, Sound Design by JoEllen Dolan and Kevin DeYoe, Set Design by David Ogle, Lighting Design by Ayumo (Poe) Saegusa , Costume Design by Stephanie Levin, Assistant Set Design byJustin Swader and Christopher Swader. Production Manager Cate Digirolamo, Stage Manager Beth Stegman.

Known for producing large scale, original experimental work, 3LD has commissioned DEEPEST MAN, and funded development residencies, as well as pre-production location shoots to gather video assets to be used in the show.

3LD’s groundbreaking use of Musion's 3D Holographic Projection System, will give our designers previously unavailable storytelling options.

3LD does things that very few theatre companies today are able to do.  We have made a commitment to artists on the cutting edge of new performance: we give these individuals the opportunity to experiment in true laboratory form with their collaborators, our team, and our technology, serving over 700+ independent artists a year and paying them for their work.

Having access to all of this incredible technology will be expensive. With rehearsals about to begin, we urgeuntly need your financial support to secure the essential elements and artists needed in this production.

So now we have an incredible story, unparalleled footage, some awesome and unique storytelling tools… but we need your help.  


What We Need 

We are asking for your donations in order to bring this work to the stage. You can play a major role in creating an original and unique piece of theater. Every donation helps. Every cent of your contribution will find its way to the stage.

Your donation will help pay the Deepest Man team, the designers, cast, and crew;    a stellar company of brilliant artists.

We have a great selection of exciting rewards as our thanks for your generosity. 


The Impact

3-Legged Dog pays its artists living wages, allowing our creative talent the ability to focus on the work, and not on side jobs.  As a result, the art created at 3LD is of the highest caliber and created by fresh, energized, focused artists.  Your support will allow us to continue this precedant that we have set.  

If we do not reach our goal, we will still pay our artists, but we fear that it may not be  as much as we believe they deserve.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you can’t contribute right now, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.Please spread the word about our campaign.

Visit our website www.deepestman.com

Like us on Facebook.

Buy tickets.

Tell people about the show.  

Help us help artists.

story:
Overview of Rock - N - Roll Debauchery


In 2013, Rock - N - Roll Debauchery (or #RnRDebauchery for short) began rocking audiences at The Cutting Room NYC.  Incorporating classic and contemporary rock music, with Broadway-caliber vocalists, host and dancers, as well as integrating lights sound and band, #RnRDebauchery has begun to lay its foundation in the interactive theater market and community.


This tantalizing theater rock experience has begun its initial workshop and performances at The Cutting Room, one of New York’s most exciting nightclub and music venues, to house capacity (200).  Having filled the venue both in April and August, 2013, and with the upcoming ‘Nightmare’ Edition on October 26, 2013, proof is already being generated as to the size, scope and future development capabilities of this production.  


Each performance of #RnRDebauchery does not necessarily tell a story in the same scope/concept as a standard  musical.  Instead, it takes the audience on a journey through music, movement, ultimately allowing the audience to create their own story in their mind and explore what is being presented individually and together.  With the openness for the audience to participate and be a part of the show, the interactive elements (still in a structuredformat) bring each performance outside the "fourth wall" and directly to each person that experiences what is being presented.


In an ever-growing community of interactive theater arts opportunities, (The Great Comet, The Orion Experience, Sleep No More, Here Lies Love, Fuerza Bruta, etc.) #RnRDebauchery is bringing a new and fresh approach to this type of dynamic experience, catering to a vast number of audience member types.


Rock

Audience members are treated to some of the biggest and most exciting songs from the past 50 years in music history.  Performed by the industries most elite singers and a band composed of rock performers, each song is culled to generate not only enjoyment from the production, but also with the goal that the audience remembers their own history with the music and embraces this fresh, new approach to these classic songs.


Roll

Roll with it. Be a part. Come in with an open mind, experience what is presented, leave with an open heart.

Debauchery

The show is sexy.  From sexy ballads to burlesque, the show allows a heightened experience of one of the strongest feelings, while still keeping a sense of never "going too far".


The Chameleon Effect

How #RnRDebauchery is structured, it is easy to add/delete/change song, dance and comedian selections depending upon the season, upcoming holidays, special occasions and events (birthday’s/anniversaries, bachelor/bachelorette parties, corporate events), and any other opportunities that may occur.  This fluidity allows #RnRDebauchery to be dynamic in the most intimate and expansive ways.


Quality Control

With a strong creative team that have each individually worked both in and outside the Broadway community (equalling over 30 years experience in total), the #RnRDebauchery brand is of the highest quality time and time again.  Using bandwagon and social media marketing as well as incentivised producer/investor relations, #RnRDebauchery brings cost-effective development and production into its formula and back-end, while maintaining the highest levels of product and placement available today.


Where do your Dollars Go? 

Funds raised from this campaign will go directly towards the production cost's of RNRD. Those cost's include paying our cast and crew; five dancers, three band members, two lead singers, a host, lighting, sound, wardrobe, camera crew, or 17 people in total! Additional expenses come from rehearsal space, promotional and marketing fees, wardrobe budget, and misc fees like parking for the camera crew and all of their equipment or last minute props needed for the show! All of this equals the most exciting and bright future for RNRD and it's audience!


Overview of Studio 7Arts


Studio 7Arts preliminary goal is to bring Broadway-Caliber classes to students K-12th grade, Foster Care and disadvantaged children primarily in the United States with the belief that no student or child should be prohibited from Arts Education due to budget cuts or economic background. Studio 7Arts will strive to enrich the growing minds of young students by nurturing their utmost artistic abilities through Dance and Musical Theater Classes.


In 2013, Studio 7Arts also began a journey into producing cutting edge / interactive theater arts experiences for the 21 and over community.  Its inception was a benefit concert and collaborative effort of some of New York's most talented performers that included an interactive Pre-Show with Performances by MIX'T DANCE, a concert benefiting the organization and Michelle Mais (from Rock of Ages) and an after performance concert by The Annie Minogue Band, (National Artist of the year by LA Music Awards).  Because of the high caliber performance that was produced and developed by Studio 7Arts as well as the extremely positive feedback from the audience and community, it became apparent that this type of benefit was going to be the first step into the actual interactive experience that would make its debut in August 2013: Rock - N - Roll Debauchery.

Creative Team Biographies


Angel Reed - Founder/Executive Producer - Studio 7Arts


Angel has spent over a decade performing and traveling all over the country. Her career began with a USO Tour in Europe followed by the 2nd Broadway National Tour of Saturday Night Fever. She also appeared on TV in 'That 70's Show' and commercials for Target and White Castle. She then had the amazing opportunity to come to NY and perform as an original cast member in Rock of Ages both Off and on Broadway, where she was one of three girl's to receive an Astaire Nomination for Best Female Dancer. She performed with her cast on numerous TV appearances including; The 09' Tony Awards, Regis & Kelly, The Today Show, Conan O'Brien and Dancing with the Stars. Since her time spent on Broadway and the birth of her baby girl, Angel has spent her time focusing on Performing Arts Education. She had the opportunity to work as a Choreographer for Students Live, an International Broadway Education Program. Additional Stage Credits include; 'West Side Story' at 5th Avenue Theater, 'Chicago' at Hudson Theater, and 'Wonderland' at Sammy Davis' Showroom with Larry Wilson.



Bryan Campione - Director


Bryan is a native of Buffalo, N.Y. and the brains behind the Twitter powerhouse: @broadway_buzz. A graduate of the University of Dayton, Bryan has performed in numerous musicals and has worked on over 25 productions both on and off-Broadway in third party marketing and sales.  A co-Executive of Blue Monkey Media, he strives to bring new and unique theater and entertainment opportunities into fruition.  Previous work includes Entertainment Sales Manager for Time Out New York Magazine,  Marketing Director at StudentsLive Broadway Education Programs, Associate Producer of Passport to Broadway International Musical Theater Intensives, Co-Executive of KlickTracx Broadway Events and the Walt Disney World College Program. Theater Training: David DeMarie Dance School (Tap, Jazz, Ballet) and UD. Key theatre work includes: Boq (Wicked “For Good” Day Events), Bryan (Cirque Du Soleil’s Zarkana Events), Peter (Jesus Christ Superstar), pre-workshop marketing associate on Jawbreaker- The Musical and Producer of Broadway Impact and Studio 7Arts benefit concerts.



Harold Lewter - Associate Producer


Harold is a Talent Manager at CLA and a producer with his company Blue Monkey Media. Director/Choreographer regional credits include: Aida, Footloose, Seussical, All Shook Up, High School Musical, Little Women, Into The Woods, Grease and more. Producing Credits include: (Stage) Tony! A Musical Revue and Summer Nights for In The Light Theater Co. (Web series) "Therapy" and upcoming "Realign'd."



Sheena DiMatteo - Resident Choreographer


Sheena’s vast repertoire of credits includes: Little Shop of Horrors, 42nd St!, Producers, West Side Story, Will Rogers Follies,On the Town, How to Succeed, Contact. Holland America M.S. Oosterdam. Phish Madison Square Garden NYE Concert,Revel Casino. Award-winning choreographer & master teacher w/Dancer's Inc, Beyond The Stars, DEA. Artistic Director of Dance In Transit Choreography www.danceintransit.org.



Ronnie Negro - Music Director


Ronnie has been a performing drummer since 1988 and an educator since 1991.  Seen primarily with his longtime band Powderfinger, Ronnie is also a first-call freelancer for live and studio drumming and has performed with well over 50 different acts, most recently with Mike Peters from The Alarm as well as alongside Air Supply's Graham Russell in a workshop for his upcoming musical LOST IN LOVE. He has also shared the stage with American Idol finalist Constantine Maroulis and Twisted Sister’s Dee Snider while drumming in Broadway’s ROCK OF AGES. Always thoroughly prepared, Ronnie brings authenticity, intensity, conviction, and a positive attitude to any performance.  Ronnie's passion for teaching matches that of his performances. In addition to giving private in-home drum lessons for over 20 years, Ronnie also provides drum instruction at Rose Hill Music Center, The Millbrook School (a private high school), and The Clear View School (day treatment facility for children with severe emotional disabilities). With the help of Ronnie's instruction, several of his students have achieved tremendous success ranging from perfect scores on their NYSMAA solos to touring the world as professional musicians themselves.
story_txt:
Overview of Rock - N - Roll Debauchery
In 2013, Rock - N - Roll Debauchery (or #RnRDebauchery for short) began rocking audiences at The Cutting Room NYC.  Incorporating classic and contemporary rock music, with Broadway-caliber vocalists, host and dancers, as well as integrating lights sound and band, #RnRDebauchery has begun to lay its foundation in the interactive theater market and community.
This tantalizing theater rock experience has begun its initial workshop and performances at The Cutting Room, one of New York’s most exciting nightclub and music venues, to house capacity (200).  Having filled the venue both in April and August, 2013, and with the upcoming ‘Nightmare’ Edition on October 26, 2013, proof is already being generated as to the size, scope and future development capabilities of this production.  
Each performance of #RnRDebauchery does not necessarily tell a story in the same scope/concept as a standard  musical.  Instead, it takes the audience on a journey through music, movement, ultimately allowing the audience to create their own story in their mind and explore what is being presented individually and together.  With the openness for the audience to participate and be a part of the show, the interactive elements (still in a structuredformat) bring each performance outside the "fourth wall" and directly to each person that experiences what is being presented.
In an ever-growing community of interactive theater arts opportunities, (The Great Comet, The Orion Experience, Sleep No More, Here Lies Love, Fuerza Bruta, etc.) #RnRDebauchery is bringing a new and fresh approach to this type of dynamic experience, catering to a vast number of audience member types.
Rock
Audience members are treated to some of the biggest and most exciting songs from the past 50 years in music history.  Performed by the industries most elite singers and a band composed of rock performers, each song is culled to generate not only enjoyment from the production, but also with the goal that the audience remembers their own history with the music and embraces this fresh, new approach to these classic songs.
Roll
Roll with it. Be a part. Come in with an open mind, experience what is presented, leave with an open heart.
Debauchery
The show is sexy.  From sexy ballads to burlesque, the show allows a heightened experience of one of the strongest feelings, while still keeping a sense of never "going too far".
The Chameleon Effect 
How #RnRDebauchery is structured, it is easy to add/delete/change song, dance and comedian selections depending upon the season, upcoming holidays, special occasions and events (birthday’s/anniversaries, bachelor/bachelorette parties, corporate events), and any other opportunities that may occur.  This fluidity allows #RnRDebauchery to be dynamic in the most intimate and expansive ways. 
Quality Control
With a strong creative team that have each individually worked both in and outside the Broadway community (equalling over 30 years experience in total), the #RnRDebauchery brand is of the highest quality time and time again.  Using bandwagon and social media marketing as well as incentivised producer/investor relations, #RnRDebauchery brings cost-effective development and production into its formula and back-end, while maintaining the highest levels of product and placement available today. 


 Where do your Dollars Go? 
Funds raised from this campaign will go directly towards the production cost's of RNRD. Those cost's include paying our cast and crew; five dancers, three band members, two lead singers, a host, lighting, sound, wardrobe, camera crew, or 17 people in total! Additional expenses come from rehearsal space, promotional and marketing fees, wardrobe budget, and misc fees like parking for the camera crew and all of their equipment or last minute props needed for the show! All of this equals the most exciting and bright future for RNRD and it's audience!

story:
WATCH OUR VIDEO!


Donations in any and all amounts are greatly appreciated!


ABOUT US:

We are NOW OR NEVER PRODUCTIONS, a new company of experienced artists coming together to make great theatre! 

Producers: Margie Ferris, Nora Matz, Diana Rusu.

MISSION STATEMENT:                                                                                                         Heart-centered communication: between artists during the rehearsal process & with audiences through performance.

We aim to set egos aside and open up to expressing truth.

While we have all worked successfully on a wide variety of NYC-based projects, we had a strong desire to put up our first production in our home county of Westchester, just north of "the city".


ABOUT THE PROJECT:

Neil LaBute's Fat Pig, is a comedic-drama about Tom who falls hard for Helen who happens to be plus-sized and then some.                                                                 

"I'm not saying she shouldn't meet somebody, but it oughta be a fat somebody, or a bald one. Whatever. Like her. A somebody that fits her . . ."


FAT PIG

Written by NEIL LABUTE

Directed by FRANCESCO CAMPARI

STAGE MANAGER: Charlotte Exton

      FEATURING: Luis Diaz, Ryan Mallon, Mary Roberts, & Jess Erick

                      "...Jess Erick is so funny and authentic she steals her scenes..."                          Cynthia Wetzler of The New York Times

                          "Jess Erick is a fabulous actress. She has a piercing specificity,                                                                      great comic timing and heartfelt sincerity."                                                                  David Deblinger, Award winning actor, writer, filmmaker /                                                                    Co-Founder Labyrinth Theater Company


Friday, December 6th @ 8PM                                                                                                     Saturday, December 7th @ 3PM & 8PM                                                                             Sunday, December 8th @ 3PM

at EMBARK, 925 South Street, Peekskill, New York 10566

RESERVATIONS:  fatpigtickets.brownpapertickets.com  OR  1-800-838-3006 


$3,000.00 will allow us to...

  • PAY FOR THE LICENSING RIGHTS TO THE PLAY
  • SECURE OUR PERFORMANCE VENUE
  • FEED OUR ARTISTS
  • RENT SET PIECES AND EQUIPMENT
  • PURCHASE PROPS
  • PRINT PROMOTIONAL MATERIALS THAT WILL LET AUDIENCE MEMBERS KNOW ABOUT THE SHOW!!!!

After a well-received reading of Fat Pig earlier this year, we launched into full production! Should we receive enough funds, we will set the intention of touring. We have two more venues who have expressed major interest in hosting us in 2014....

Donate dollar(s) &/or good karma!  Please share the link to our page with others!

story:
Presents:

                 

                         

                          Tickets on sale here and on our website!

The Play:

      "a voyeuristic look into the life of a rural Wisconsin family living the faded                                               American dream." -Daniel Dvorkin, Artistic Director

“We're animals. We just react. We never have to understand ourselves. The desire to put words to it is just a desire for the illusion of control over your life." - John Schneider, Pleasant Dreams

The year is 1978. Set in the pleasant vacation town of Waukesha, Wisconsin, three siblings and their significant others reunite for a lavish backyard birthday party. The ugly divorce and subsequent absence of their parents, as well as the looming fear of their own diminishing lives, are the topics of conversation...and a perfectly good way to ruin a perfectly pleasant afternoon. 

The performance will be accompanied with a live band covering the nostalgic tunes of Les Paul and Mary Ford and a "Tableau Vivant Series" inspired by John Schneider's script.

                             

The evening will also consist of a Two Lights Theatre Co. Visual Art Series, a Tableau Vivant collection consisting of six images taken at different times of day as written in the scenes of Schneider's script. Luring and nostalgic, these colorful images are made to give the viewer a sense of the story without giving away too many of the details. They will function as part of the set and will be seen as a touring series around various coffee shops in the Chicago area. 

The series is made in collaboration with the photography of Christian Nam and Karin Kuroda and will be presented at the show as well as ACTIVATE, in coalition with Pop Up Art Loop's Fall Gallery Walk: September 12th 5-10PM, Couch Place Alley, North of State and Randolph. Free Admission for the Gallery Walk Event.

The Company: 

"Two Lights is the new kid diving into the crowded pool of Chicago indie theater, and with its debut production of The Altruists, it makes one hell of a splash. I look forward to more great things from this very talented group." - Chicago Theater Beat

"These are talented folks, seriously well trained. They have a precocious polish..." - Tony Adler, Chicago Reader

___________________________________________

Our Mission:

a multidisciplinary community of artists, 
a zeal for innovative story telling,
a commitment to process. 

We believe in the union of visual art and theatre, collaborating with artists across diverse mediums to tell a story.

___________________________________________

The TLTC Team:

Executive Artistic Director: Daniel Dvorkin
Managing Director: Melissa Rose
Assoc. Artistic Director: Bridget Schreiber 
Assoc. Artistic Director: Matt Olson
Production Manager: Eleni Sauvageau
Casting Director: Michael Theisen
Director of Audience Relations: Dan Smeriglio

Company Members: Sammi Grant, Olivia Grzasko, Shana Johnson, Aaron Kirby, Rebecca Leifman, Melanie Plank, Amy Rapp, and Colin Sphar

_______________________________________

What We Need 

We are seeking funds in order to cover the following production costs:

$3,000- rental of the beautiful and historic Chopin Theatre

We're back at The Chopin this year because we loved it so much for The Altruists and so did our audiences! We're happy to be raising our company in such an exciting venue and need your help to keep us in the space!

$2,000 - Scenic/Installation supplies, props, costumes, Lighting, and sound equipment: 

Want to purchase the landscaping for our show's backyard? Or perhaps you want to buy a meal for the Pleasant Dreams dinner scene?  Maybe you'd want to help us buy a piece of vintage clothing for an actor? It all helps!

$2,000- Artist Wages: 

Help pay our talented team of designers, actors, musicians, and production crew for all their hard work! With seven cast members, four band members, and over ten on the production crew, there are a lot of great collaborators bringing Pleasant Dreams to the stage, and they deserve it!

Contributor Theme Songs

In addition to your perks described on the right, we'd like to throw you a sweet-sweet tune for your kindness. Check out the video below according to the title of your donation amount, and you might just get to sing along to your song the night of the show! Les Paul and Mary Ford everyone:

49 and Below: Mockin' Bird Hill
50-99:              Tiger Rag
100-249:          Home Sweet Home
250-499:          In The Good Old Summertime
500-999:          Waiting for the Sunrise
1000 and Above:How High the Moon

                   

The Impact

Your contribution will help employ and bring together over twenty talented young, hard working professionals producing relevant art and theatre. 

John Schneider's script deals with themes such as the faded American Dream and a fear of turning into your parents while celebrating family simultaneously. Your support will help us produce not only a play but an evenings worth of entertainment for our Chicago audiences to enjoy. 

We are currently in the process of applying for our 501(c)3, and with your help on this project, we can make that happen come the end of this fall!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about our company and our project! Share our link on social networking and with your friends and family. 

Like our Facebook page and our Indiegogo page. Use the Indiegogo share tools located below the video to send our campaign to others who might help out.

We encourage you to check back regularly and visit our sites below. Stay up to date on the latest news! Tickets are up for sale now on our website, so don't miss the show! 

Thank you and Pleasant Dreams!

Two Lights Theatre Company

The Impact

John Schneider's script deals with themes such as the faded American Dream and a fear of turning into your parents while celebrating family simultaneously. Your support will help us produce not only a play but an evenings worth of entertainment for our Chicago audiences to enjoy. 
We are currently in the process of applying for our 501(c)3, and with your help on this project, we can make that happen come the end of this fall!
Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word about our company and our project! Share our link on social networking and with your friends and family. 
Like our Facebook page and our Indiegogo page. Use the Indiegogo share tools located below the video to send our campaign to others who might help out.
We encourage you to check back regularly and visit our sites below. Stay up to date on the latest news! Tickets are up for sale now on our website, so don't miss the show! 
Thank you and Pleasant Dreams!
Two Lights Theatre Company

story:
Join us for a night of masquerade fun!

For a couple years, I have had the desire to throw a New Year's Eve masquerade where people could dress in costume and have fun with others while ringing in the New Year. This year, 2013, I decided it was time to stop thinking about throwing a masquerade and actually *do* it. But it requires money to do just that, and to make it as phenomenal as possible.

The goal is to make this an annual event that everyone can look forward to and that can expand for more to enjoy. 

The first thing that was most important was getting a hotel secured for the event, and to find a DJ. Mission accomplished on both counts!

The masquerade will be hosted at the Lancaster Host Resort & Conference Center in Lancaster, PA.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to help offset the costs, there will be a $20 cover charge, but I am also giving the option for people to donate more if they wish to help out with other costs, including decorations and the DJ:

  • If you are paying for more than one person as you donate, choose the higher "perk" and make a private comment saying that you are paying for the cover charge for more than one person- please include your name and their name(s) so that I can make a note in my spreadsheet.
    • All funding raised goes directly into the event by paying for:
      • Catering at the hotel
      • The DJ services of C.F. Star Entertainment
      • Decor
      • An additional tip for the bartender since it is a cash bar
    • A $15 supporting donation has been added. This is for people that may want to attend this year but can not, but still want to help. They will receive the following:
      • An engraved champagne flute
      • Special recognition at the masquerade 
    • $20 cover charge covers your cost to attend. This includes your buffet dinner, entertainment for the evening, and a champagne toast at midnight.
    • Any donations of $25-30, you will receive the following in addition to the buffet, entertainment for the evening, and a champagne toast at midnight:
      • Special recognition at the masquerade

    The Future

    I hope that this is just the first year of this event. When I intially decided to go for it while planning, it has always been with the intent of creating a fun and inspiring event that could lead to an annual event people look forward to that just keeps growing each year- both in attendance, costumes, and the level of creativity.

story:
Tracing the diverging paths of two childhood friends as they enter young adulthood, Lydia & Tom is a celebration of our formative relationships and a reflection on the challenges we face in trying to sustain those relationships as we grow and change. Lydia & Tom's college-age creators draw on personal experience, lending the story an exciting immediacy and a sensitivity toward portraying the characters' transition into adulthood with accuracy. Honest, joyful, and gently moving, Lydia & Tom wrestles with growing up and out of each other.

Conceived and developed by a group of Columbia University students in the spring of 2012, Lydia and Tom was brought to life that fall. We are thrilled to have the opportunity to bring Lydia & Tom to the New York International Fringe Festival this August.  For anyone unfamiliar, Fringe is New York’s largest independent theatre festival.

It is a long road from Morningside Heights to the downtown theater scene, and we need your help getting all the way there!  Please consider making a donation - contributions of all quantities are welcome and vital to our upcoming production of Lydia & Tom.

Thank you so much for your support.  We cannot do it without your help.

story:
Our Mission

With inspiration coming from the music, our choreography has a focus on athleticism, intention, and simplicity.  Our mission is to present works that demonstrate these qualities while providing audiences of all backgrounds a visual spectacle they are intrigued by and can enjoy.

Our Story

Director and choreographer Jillian Davis is from rural roots in Kutztown, PA, where her parents placed her in dance classes starting at age 3.  Discovering a love of ballet immediately and being recognized for her talent at an early age, teachers and mentors lead her to more serious ballet training.  Jillian was lucky enough to study at some of the countries most prestigious ballet schools, including Pacific Northwest Ballet, Lines Ballet Summer Program, School of American Ballet, and San Francisco Ballet.

After expressing her continued interest in choreography while dancing in San Francisco, director Frederick Gaudette, whom she was working with, asked her to create a piece on a member of the company.  Fluid Interference was premiered in August 2012, establishing Jillian's unique style and showing how she works directly with the music. After her choreographic premiere, Jillian was asked to create a piece at her former studio, Princeton Dance and Theater Studio, for a talented student competing in YAGP.  She was also asked to be a guest artist and choreographer at Missouri Valley College for the 2013-2014 school year. City Living (remix) was shown at the school's spring performance February 2014.

Jillian decided to start Jillian Davis Dance Project (JDDP) when she was selected as a finalist at Rider University's Emerging Choreographers Competition, where she presented her newest ensemble work, Tiel.  She aims to continue creating new works and also allow dancers interested in their own choreography to explore their thoughts and possibilities.

Our Goal for 2014

With your support to Jillian Davis Dance Project, we want to you become involved in the whole process of creating and staging works. 

  • For 2014, we are striving for a goal of $5000.  This will be put towards rehearsal and performance space, custom-made costumes, travel expenses, applications to dance festivals, and compensation to the dancers for their time and energy.
  • With our monthly email updates from director Jillian Davis, we will keep you up-to-date on what is happening in the company, invitations to in-studio dress rehearsals, and a chance for you to have coffee or drinks with Jillian Davis, her dancers, and guests.
  • Ultimately, we want you to be with us every step way, from rehearsals, applying to festivals, setting works, and the performance.

Spread the Word!

Here at Jillian Davis Dance Project, we are always looking to meet new people to become a part of our family and to share our mission with.

  • Share our project and our mission with friends, family, colleagues, or anyone you feel would enjoy and support our projects and goals with Jillian Davis Dance Project.
  • If you want to share a skill you have with Jillian Davis Dance Project, we are always looking for people to join our team!  This could include graphic/web design, costumes, music, etc.  We always love to work with new creative artists and minds to see the possibilities that can emerge.

Thank you so much for your support of Jillian Davis Dance Project!  If you have any inquiries or questions, feel free to send an email to jilliandavisdanceproject@gmail.com and Jillian Davis will get back to you as soon as she can.

story:
Battered But Not Broken

Unfortunately today, MANY of us are aware of someone who is in a relationship which is bad for them. Many of us may have chosen to keep quiet because we were asked to. Or we may have kept quiet because WE were unsure of exactly how we could help!

  • One in 4 women will experience domestic violence during her lifetime.
  • Women experience more than 4 million physical assaults and rapes because of their partners, and men are victims of nearly 3 million physical assaults.
  • Women are more likely to be killed by an intimate partner than men.
  • Women ages 20 to 24 are at greatest risk of becoming victims of domestic violence.
  • Every year, 1 in 3 women who is a victim of homicide is murdered by her current or former partner.

And most surprising:

Only approximately one-quarter of all physical assaults, one-fifth of all rapes, and one-half of all stalkings perpetuated against females by intimate partners are reported to the police.

But YOU can help us STOP this cycle with your donation!

The play Battered But Not Broken deals with the chilling story of Justina and Sebastian Blessing and their relationship as it relates to domestic violence and being able to escape in a safe, methodical manner.​

Justina will suffer the consequences of her parents actions. She will meet a man, Sebastian Blessing that by all appearances seems to the opposite of what she experienced as a child. What she thinks is a dream come true will turn out to be a nightmare. She will triumph over obstacles that would destroy most women. She will live and she will learn, hopefully the lessons that she learns will teach all of us about our own self. This is a story of a test of wills, a story of love and forgiveness, and to God they are one and the same and God's will shall be done. It will take faith, trust, love, forgiveness, intelligence, common sense, obedience and a plan to escape in one piece. Prayer changes things. Justina will prevail, but not without a fight.​​​​​

What We Need:

As with all stage productions that travel, we require funds to cover the bare minimum of what we need. The bare minimum that the funds raised here will cover are:

  • Venue Costs
  • Travel and Lodging
  • Props

The Impact

What we plan to do with this play is to assist women, men and children affected by domestic violence.  We will give 40% of the box office to a domestic violence shelter in every perspective city we travel to.

Other Ways You Can Help

We do understand that funds may be tight however this is an great chance to take a stand with us in STOPPING the domestic violence cycle! So help us make some noise by SHARING this campaign with EVERYONE and asking them to take a stand with us!

That stand only takes $5!

story:
Hello!

My name is James Masciovechio. And I am addicted to the movie Clue!

I am also a Actor/Director. 

So what better way to combine my love of CLUE and my love of Theater! by getting my friends together and doing a fun and exciting reading of the screenplay! 

What We Need & What You Get

We aren't asking for a lot, just a little capital to cover Venue, Props, and Costumes. All the actors are doing this for good ol fashioned fun! To help entice you we have a few goodies in store for those who donate. Including our top prize a nice bottle of Cognac (Not Poisoned....)!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just by coming out to see the show, supporting us and supporting our venue 61 Local. 

 

 

Where: 61 Local. 61 Bergen St. Cobble Hill, Brooklyn, NY

When: September 18th @ 7:30PM 

Who's in it:

 

Wadsworth- Josh Triplett

Yvette- Cassie Wood

Mustard- Bradley J. Sumner

White- Dina Desmone

Scarlet- Emily Dalton

Plum- Alex Etling

Peacock- Emily Ludolph

Green- Robert Hooghkirk

Victims - Allison Frederich

Stage Directions- Laura Melchiorre

story:
WELCOME TO MY CAMPAIGN!

Hello! My name is Stacie Cannon. I am a full-time dance student at Peridance Capezio Center in New York City. I am enrolled in the 2-year Certificate Program under the ballet/contemporary track ("This track offers training with established and innovative faculty in classical ballet, modern, and the latest contemporary techniques to prepare students for work with major dance companies and the concert stage"). This track includes:

  • 3-4 technique classes per day, 5 days a week
  • Dance and performance-based academic classes
  • Repertory rehearsals with rotating choreographers
  • Performance and choreographic opportunities
  • Access to specialized seminars and workshops
  • Body conditioning classes including Yoga/Pilates/Stretch/GYROKINESIS
  • Personal mentoring and guidance
  • Contact and network-building with top choreographers, teachers, directors, and agents 






Currently, I am in my second year of the program. I was awarded a partial scholarship by the school but I still need to raise $4,300  by January 2, 2014 to cover the final portion of this year's tuition.

WHY AM I RAISING MONEY???

Some of you may already know that I held a campaign for part of my tuition last year as well. Thanks to everyone who supported by donating or sharing my campaign page, it was extremely successful. I even raised $100 more than my expected goal. This year, I am raising money due to unexpected health issues over the span of the last school year. There was a growing tumor found in my right ovary that was causing a lot of pain and discomfort, sickness and affecting my ability to dance at my best everyday. With multiple tests and consultations, I was advised by my doctor to have surgery to remove the tumor before it got any bigger or caused more problems. I had the right ovary and fallopian tube removed. Disrupting my plans of working full-time in NY over the summer, instead, I recovered in Virginia for 6+ weeks. Hospital and surgery bills have put a strain on my finances which is why I'm having difficulty paying my tuition. Faculty, family and friends have all suggested that I try another campaign, one last time. So here I go!!!

This campaign is important to me because it will allow me to continue my training at Peridance which has already helped me improve greatly in just one year. As an extremely committed person and growing artist, I would love to be able to complete this program at the end of the school year and receive my certificate. With your help, I will be on my way toward graduating this upcoming spring!

 HOW YOU CAN HELP!

1) Give a donation of any amount. (Each donation has a perk!)

2) Share my campaign on your Facebook page, Twitter, Instagram...you get the idea:)

3) Share my campaign link

Thank you for your time, support and love. I look forward to reaching my goal and sharing  that victory with you!!!

story:
UPDATE
Hi everyone! We've got 2 weeks left on this campaign, and we need your help now more than ever! 
We had a great fundraising event at the beginning of October, where we shared with many of you a few scenes from Versailles. The event was a success and we were extremely pleased with the feedback we received for the reading. 
However, we have made only a very small dent in the total we will need to produce this play in just a few short months. We make no effort to hide the fact the this place requires a hefty sum to produce: $20,000. So far we have raised just about 7% of that, between this campaign and contributions made at the fundraiser. So now we appeal to you here, please open your wallets and checkbooks and contribute generously. Consider it a holiday present to us! And unlike those sweaters and fruit cakes you send out, this gift will yield YOU something in return! An amazing play, opening this February at the Theater for the New City!


Thank you in advance for your generosity! 


Here is a short clip from the reading at the Fundraiser:





YOUR generous support for this project is essential to bring Versailles to the stage.  

Contribute now and plan to join us for one of the twelve scheduled performances starting 20 February and running through 9 March 2014 

Tickets may be purchased online through BrownPaperTickets.com/Versailles

In appreciation for your support there are various perks available to you, based on your level of contribution. 

Or, if you would prefer to decline the associated perks, just click the "fund now" button, scroll down, select "no perks" and contribute an amount that best suits you! 

Share this fundraising link with your friends and family and ask them to share it within their social networks as well!

If you would like to be kept in the loop on future Nedworks, Inc. productions,  please visit our website:

NedWorksProduction.org

And subscribe to our mailing list!

story:
Help!!! Our Wonderettes are Stuck in LA!

As you saw in the video, three of the Four Actors Point Wonderettes were left behind (by accident, we think) during the most recent Springfield High School Glee Club competition.  The girls don't want to disappoint the prom committee since the Crooning Crabcakes already did that to them earlier this year!!  Did we mention the Marvelous Wonderettes are getting to sing at the prom? 

Why help "The Marvelous Wonderettes?"

Actors Point Theatre Company has the privilege of being the first theatre to bring this fabulous musical to the Nashville area!!  Don't take our word for it.  Here is what the critics say about the show:

“You won’t find a more delightful girl group! These irrepressible, bubbly Wonderettes are singing their hearts out in this charming, fast-paced musical. Beautiful singing, well-honed timing, often poignant, and highly entertaining.” –The Associated Press

“One irresistible musical! An utter charm bomb!” –The New York Times

“Don’t buy a ticket—buy two! It’s a show you’ll want to see twice.” –Back Stage

“Iconic ‘50s pop hits shine in this bubbly musical.” –New York Magazine

“An expertly wrought showcase of ‘50s and ‘60s pop music—it’s tremendously fun.” –Variety

“A generous evening of entertainment. Move over, Forever Plaid!” –Back Stage West 

“It doesn’t get better than this!” –Dr. Joi Browne, WOR Radio

“A good time! Audiences leave beaming and humming. An infectiously charming homage to the music of the 1950s and 1960s.” –theatermania.com 

“A fun, fun, fun show! Very highly recommended. The tune-packed show is a stroll down memory lane with plenty of laughs and great singing.” –Edge NY

“The Marvelous Wonderettes is deliciously enjoyable.” –Los Angeles Times

 Additionally, several of our Wonderettes have done the show recently in other professional theatrical venues across the nation.  Here's a sample of what the critics shared about the show and their work:

"The Disney princess front girl of the Wonderettes is Cindy Lou Huffington, played well by the silky smooth Catherine Birdsong, who flaunts her beautiful flowing hair, alabaster skin and perkiness to match."

"BJ Reynolds is the strong-voiced, brash tomboy of the group, portrayed effectively by Marie Wise-Hawkins."

What We Need 

We really need $8,000.00  to pave the way for the return of the three lost Wonderettes (Okay...Really to cover royalties and other tremendous fees including purchase of music, neato and groovy costumes, sound equipment upgrades for the show, sets,  etc.). 

Did we mention we pay our actors?   We firmly believe it is only right to compensate the professional artists involved in productions at Actors Point.  They work so hard to deliver high caliber entertainment to you.  We are honored to have been able to cast seasoned stage, film, and television professionals in our productions.

What You Get

A gift to our campaign will not go unappreciated!!!  We will be so very thankful to you, we have come up with some absolutely thrilling premiums to reward you for your generosity. 

  • $1000+ - Free limo service to one event in the Nashville area and 2 season's tickets (show and dinner) for Actors Point Theatre Company's upcoming season! 
  • $500 - Two season's tickets (show and dinner) for Actors Point Theatre Company's upcoming season!
  • $250 - Two season's tickets (show only) for Actors Point Theatre Company's upcoming season!
  • $100 - Two show only tickets to see "The Marvelous Wonderettes!" - A $36 value!
  • $50 - One show only ticket to see "The Marvelous Wonderettes!" - and an invitation to the cast party opening night!
  • $25 - An invitation to the cast party opening night and an autographed cast photo or poster!
  • $10 - An autographed cast photo or poster!

All acts of financial generosity will be highlighted in our show program!  Just think...Your name in the program as the real star of our show!!! 

Thank you in advance for helping us reach our goal so we can bring this show to you in all its marvelous wonder!!

The Impact

Your contribution will help us bring the Wonderettes to our stage!!  We know those who see the show will appreciate your sacrifice for the sake of live theatre.  Actors Point is committed to exceptional theatrical experiences for all.  We use any additional show revenue to create performance and educational experiences for students in our summer camp programs as well as to enable us to coninue to provide outstanding theater in the future. 

Our Mission: 

The mission of Actors Point Theatre Company is to enrich the cultural lives of residents of Middle Tennessee.  The Actors Point Theatre Company will endeavor to engage, inspire, entertain, educate, and challenge audiences with theatrical productions that range from the classics to new works; we will train and support the next generation of theatre artists; we will provide arts education programs that promote life-long learning to a diverse community; and we celebrate the essential power of the theatre to help stimulate the communities we serve both culturally and economically.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute at this time, you can still help.  Here's how:

  • Please help us get the word out about this campaign.  You can do that by using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Come see the show!!  You won't be sorry!!
story_txt:
Help!!! Our Wonderettes are Stuck in LA!
As you saw in the video, three of the Four Actors Point Wonderettes were left behind (by accident, we think) during the most recent Springfield High School Glee Club competition.  The girls don't want to disappoint the prom committee since the Crooning Crabcakes already did that to them earlier this year!!  Did we mention the Marvelous Wonderettes are getting to sing at the prom?

story:
About The Company

Signal Theatre emits ideas, images and stories.

We engage in practiced-based research to create live performance. Signal is interdisciplinary and intercultural, creating work that reflects and privileges indigenous knowledges, as well as international creation methodologies that situate physical rigour and exploration as the centre of the work.

Signal is committed to the collaborative process, experimentation and intercultural research. 

Our vision is to enrich the Canadian landscape through public performance/ interventions and to broaden the social and political awareness of our audiences. 


About The Project

A Soldier's Tale is a new full-length dance theatre work in two acts, premiering at the Fleck Dance Theatre in February 2014. 

Choreographed and directed by Michael Greyeyes and written by Tara Beagan, co-artistic director of Article 11. Our thematic focus is the aftermath of war, as it reverberates and echoes in the lives of those it touches.

This dance theatre work probes the lives of soldiers over the span of fifty years, from the end of the Second World War to our involvement in Iraq and Afghanistan, examining the ugly realities of war, reminding us of George Santayana's powerful Soliloquies in England and later Soliloquies, "Only the dead have seen the end of war."


Project Collaborators 

For this project, Signal Theatre has brought together an exceptional team, including:

Yvette Nolan as dramaturge, John Gzowski as composer, Shawn Kerwin as set and costume designer, Andy Moro as sound designer, and Elizabeth Asselstine as lighting designer. 

The cast includes: Louis Laberge-Côté, Keith Barker, Kate Holden, Tamara Podemski, Michael Caldwell, Nancy Latoszewski, PJ Prudat, Jamie Maczko, Daniel McArthur and Ana Groppler.

A Soldier's Tale is co-produced by the National Arts Centre and the Canada Dance Festival and will premiere at the Fleck Dance Theatre in February, as part of the 2013/2014 DanceWorks Main stage season. 


Where Does My Money Go?

As an emerging theatre company, Signal Theatre is committed to the professional artists we work with. 

This includes providing our collaborators, all independent artists, with a living wage and the resources to create and practice their art. Your contribution to this project rewards our artists and the many stakeholders, including our funding partners who have already invested in the development of A Soldier’s Tale.

In addition, this campaign and your generous participation ensures an important mandate – providing access to this work for veterans and their families, as well as providing invaluable work experience for youth, interested in the performing arts. A large portion of this funding campaign will subsidize tickets for veterans and provide two work-study positions for emerging artists. 


Company History 

Signal Theatre is a non-profit organization founded in 2010 by Michael Greyeyes (Plains Cree). Signal places the human at the centre of our theatrical practice and, as our Elders have instructed, it seeks to make us whole, empowered, and connected to one another. 

Signal premiered from thine eyes, a co-production with Native Earth Performing Arts, at Harbourfront Centre, Enwave Theatre in 2011. This work was programmed at the 2012 Prismatic Festival in Halifax, NS. 

Signal recently produced Nôhkom at the Banff Centre, alongside Valley of Coal, a work by Nancy Latoszewski in 2013 and produced Concert During Wartime at The Music Gallery with composer John Gzowski.

We have a number of projects in development, including Winter Home, an installation exploring a Cree family's wintering history, and a new full-length opera-based work with collaborators Spy Denommé-Welch and Yvette Nolan.

Thanks for visiting our campaign! If you'd like more information about our company or this project please visit our website and our social media outlets. If you are unable to assist us financially with our campaign, you can always spread the word! Please feel free to like, share, and retweet! Chi Meegwetch. Thank you.

story:
UpRise! Productions is dedicated to bringing the voices of writers of color to the stage in the Austin, Tx area. We are one of a few companies who consistently feature these writers.  Zell Miller, III, is the artistic director of UpRise! Productions.  Last year, we produced a very successful and award-winning version of “For Colored Girls who considered suicide when the rainbow is enuf”. This year, we are proud to bring to Austin one of the greatest American plays ever written, “A Raisin in the Sun” by Lorraine Hansberry.  We are bringing one on the architects of “The Jazz Aesthetic," as well as an Obie and Bessie Award winner, Laurie Carlos, to direct our production.  Laurie has been Zell's personal mentor for over 15 years.  If you have enjoyed Zell's work in the Austin area, then Laurie is to thank.  Zell's first community production in Austin as a child was A Raisin in the Sun, playing the role of Travis.  Zell is excited to now perform in the role of Walter, which brings Zell's Austin theatre experience full circle. 

We are in need of your financial support to bring this amazing play to the stage.  Funds raised will go to such production costs as Director fees and travel, scenery construction, marketing, Actor fees, lighting and sound equipment rental, and costumes.

 

Please consider helping us by donating what you can to this campaign and spreading the word about our production. Thank you for your support.

 

We also hope to see you at the show, August 1-17, at The Vortex in Austin.

story:
we are raising money for a tight rope + wood for coffins

so we can make this play for obscure Canadian ConocoPhillips

your donation goes entirely to the bare bones that we need to make this theatre

which is more like virus in a petri dish

than anything in ice capades

 we want to bring you something germinating

 please help us

 

 

JESSICA ALMASY is part otter part jungle cat, writing plays in the MFA program w Mac Wellman + Erin Courtney at Brooklyn College. she is a founding member of the TEAM w whom she has deciphered the roles of a backwards Dorothy from Oz as New York falling out of a plane into Kansas,  a PTSD adolescent / post-JFK Hamlet, Richard Nixon as a woman in a glass box, the classic Margaret Mitchell but after Hollywood eats Hurricane Katrina, and a teenage anarchist rebuilding a city in a massive multiplayer game. she is an avid audiobook actress (www.audible.com) and works in theatre, film, TV, and commercials wherein she was most recently the spokesperson for Friendly’s ice cream. she is the Bunny in the Bunny & Pants, w partner & Pants / Chantal Pavageaux.

 

it is an art conglomerate. her dogs are from Louisiana, they are named King + Pie, they have bayou eyes. her first baby + greatest endeavor yet, arrives for she + Adam Friedstein v shortly.her plays: RIDG LAPS at Dixon Place (MAR, 13) GEORGE WASHINGTON SLEPT HERE (now called BLOODY SHOW) at the Bushwick Starr Reading Series (APR, 13), her text appeared in the installation / performance art premiere A Marriage: 1 (Suburbia) by artists Nick Vaughn + Jake Margolin at HERE (MAY, 13). she has taught acting around the country and internationally w the TEAM, and in a course of her own making most recently at NYU. BFA, Tisch / MFA, Brooklyn College. she lives + believes in New Jersey

 

 

 

ConocoPhillips is a heretofore ultimately unknown experimental Canadian playwright whose works were found when a dilapidated Super Stop + Shop on the outskirts of Ontario exploded, where she had worked as a cashier, + where her playscripts were buried (under aisle 13, “spices”). investigations into her life reveal that her work did not resemble what was considered “popular” “Canadian” “culture” + therefore, could not or did not receive the proper funding or opportunity to reach its public. Conoco was a great lover of the arts, but mostly as they manifested themselves in the experience of day to day life, especially the typically undocumented, especially in the suburbs. thank you, + may you LIVE ON, CONOCO

story:
Who we are and our project:

We are a theatre company called Poise Performance, which was founded by Youth Theatre Director Josh Ward and film/theatre Producer Liane Escorza.

We use cross-media, multi-sensorial and multi-disciplinary work (classic and physical theatre, literature, dance, music, video/film, art installation) to showcase thoroughly re-imagined and re-invented adaptations of classical text.

Our debut theatre show is “Dorian Gray”, an adaptation of Oscar Wilde’s work. It will take place on 7 – 26 October 2013, at the CLF Art Café aka The Bussey Building, in Peckham Rye.

We are keen to get the community involved not only by engaging audiences during the show but also by having them create art and work together on scenic elements of the play, therefore becoming an essential part of it. We are working with:

Leaders of Tomorrow, Kids Company, Peckham Vision, Safe n Sound Youth Project, Peckham Shed and Prison Reform Trust.

By supporting us you will be generously giving to these groups while making this initiative happen.

Our Campaign:

We need £15000 to fund this project. We are launching a campaign to obtain funds from different sources such as the Arts Council and other public bodies, yet unfortunately we cannot cover all costs incurred in the production. That is why we need your generous donations. £15000 will help us pay for the costs of:

-        our venue in full – for the 3 week run with 7 shows per week

-        the film sections of the show – equipment and filmmaker

-        marketing – press, photos, print, invites, flyers, posters, web, social media...

-       the pre-recorded soundtrack, studio hire and sound equipment

-       insurance of all equipment, production and our art installation and works

-       costumes and props

-       lighting equipment hire, insurance and venue engineer

-       Rehearsal studio hire and expenses

What we need: 

If you could spare a donation, big or small, you could help us reach our target.

We won’t be able to showcase our work this October without you. We won't be able to have the kids and young groups of Peckham participate in the show without you! Your generosity could be the springboard for producing future shows in London and around the UK with exciting artistic collaborations and further community engagement. 

Please donate. Spread the word. Contact us if you want to collaborate in any way!

What we can offer you:

There are nine tiers in our campaign. And lots of things on offer in exchange for your wonderful help!! CHECK OUT THE PERKS!
